snippet: The scandal surrounding the closing of lanes to the George Washington Bridge in September has sullied the image of the once-staid transportation tool.
abstract: Scandal surrounding lane closings at George Washington Bridge in September 2013 has sullied the image of the traffic study, once-staid transportation tool; Samuel Schwartz, former New York City traffic commissioner, says jokes arising from fact that Port Authority of New York and New Jersey officials used far-fetched cover story of a traffic study to cover growing scandal could hurt credibility of the profession.
lead_paragraph: The scandal surrounding the closing of lanes to the George Washington Bridge in September has sullied the image of the once-staid transportation tool.

headline.main: Bridge Scandal Relegates ‘Traffic Study’ to Punch Line
headline.print_headline: Bridge Scandal Relegates ‘Traffic Study’ to Punch Line

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
